physical_appearance: This is a black-and-white photograph. It is square in shape and portrait in orientation. It features several statues within a built, cave-like structure. There are three man-like statues in the photograph. They are built and arranged to show a scene whereby two of the statues are attacking the third one on the floor.
sgcool_label_text: This is a personal photograph album that belonged to a Corporal A. Silver who spent 16 months in Singapore between 1951 and 1952. Silver was presumably a Jewish lady who was stationed in Singapore to serve at the Royal Air Force (RAF) Hospital at Changi. The album contains photographs that document her working and personal life, including friends she made within the Jewish community in Singapore.
title_text: "Personal photograph album titled ""Sixteen Months in Singapore""" Sixteen Months in Singapore: Photograph of statues in Haw Par Villa
